page.title: 20WATER MANAGEMENT
page.content:
The River Witham runs locally through Wyndham Park and Riverside Park, past Manthorpe and Belton Villages. Its upkeep is the work of the Anglian Water Authority. Just recently a controversial subject has been the use of lead shot in local angling. Ducks, Geese and Swans graze in water 2 to 3 feet deep and if the lead shot is tangled in the weeds the birds swallow it and it has dire consequences.
The Department of the Environment recently indicated to the Goverment that it would consider making an order under the control of Polution Act 1974, banning the import and sale of such lead shot.
At its monthly meeting in autumn 1985 the A.W.A. agreed that this would make sense.
